data.title: WHEN WORLDS COLLIDE by Wylie, Philip; Balmer, Edwin
data.meta_description: Philadelphia: J.B. Lippincott Company, 1950. Very good plus in very good jacket.. Midcentury reprint of the classic Atomic Age science fiction...
data.text:
Â· Philadelphia

by Wylie, Philip; Balmer, Edwin

Philadelphia: J.B. Lippincott Company, 1950. Very good plus in very good jacket.. Midcentury reprint of the classic Atomic Age science fiction disaster novel, with far-reaching cultural influence from the 1951 film adaptation to the lyrics of the Rocky Horror Picture Show opening number, reissued together with its 1934 sequel in a single volume. 7.25'' x 5''. Original taupe cloth. In original unclipped ($2.95) pictorial dust jacket. 1-344, [xvi], 341, [1] pages. Corners lightly bumped. Moderate chipping to jacket at extremities, with small closed tear and traces of soil to rear panel. (Inventory #: 48345)
